content:
The synthesis method was based on that described previously. Ni­(CH3COO)2·4H2O (0.025 g, 0.1 mmol) and 4,4′-azopyridine (azo) (0.0092 g, 0.05 mmol) were dissolved in a mixture of 2 mL of CH3CN and 3 mL of H2O, and the mixture was stirred at 100 °C for 1 h. Then, the mixture of 1-aminobenzene-3,4,5-tricarboxylic acid (H3L) (0.022 g, 0.1 mmol) and 1 mL of H2O was added and adjusted to pH 9 with a 2 M NaOH solution. After the mixture had been heated at 100 °C for 24 h, yellow crystals were obtained.

Preparation of Nafion/MOF Composite Membranes

A certain amount of MOFs (5%, relative to the weight percentage of Nafion) was added to DMF to achieve ultrasonic dispersion for 1 h. Then Nafion was added to the solution mentioned above and stirred for 6 h to obtain a homogeneous casting solution. The casting solution was poured into a glass Petri dish and kept at 80 °C for 10 h. The dried membrane was immersed in a H2SO4 solution at pH 2 and 80 °C for 1 h for acidification and then soaked in deionized water to remove the residual acid solution on the membrane surface.
clean_text:
Syntheses of {[Ni1.5(L)(4,4'-azobpy)(H2O)]⋅6.5H2O} n  (MOF-azo)

The synthesis method was based on that described previously. Ni(CH3COO)2⋅4H2O (0.025 g, 0.1 mmol) and 4,4'-azopyridine (azo) (0.0092 g, 0.05 mmol) were dissolved in a mixture of 2 mL of CH3CN and 3 mL of H2O, and the mixture was stirred at 100 °C for 1 h. Then, the mixture of 1-aminobenzene-3,4,5-tricarboxylic acid (H3L) (0.022 g, 0.1 mmol) and 1 mL of H2O was added and adjusted to pH 9 with a 2 M NaOH solution. After the mixture had been heated at 100 °C for 24 h, yellow crystals were obtained.

Preparation of Nafion/MOF Composite Membranes

A certain amount of MOFs (5%, relative to the weight percentage of Nafion) was added to DMF to achieve ultrasonic dispersion for 1 h. Then Nafion was added to the solution mentioned above and stirred for 6 h to obtain a homogeneous casting solution. The casting solution was poured into a glass Petri dish and kept at 80 °C for 10 h. The dried membrane was immersed in a H2SO4 solution at pH 2 and 80 °C for 1 h for acidification and then soaked in deionized water to remove the residual acid solution on the membrane surface.

precursor.name: MOFs
precursor.unit: relative to the weight percentage of Nafion
